content:
I am no longer a young man with idealistic world-views. I own my home, gold, and some ICP assets. I am here to make a profit and secure a future for my daughters, it is as simple as that. My thesis is that the Motoko assets will outpace the base currency considerably. DFINITY needs a marketing arm, and this brand and respective assets are perfect for that.  Once a DAO is formed, it would be in their best interests to pour resources into this community and let it flourish. 

Spirits are currently low as the nft space is in a lull period. It will return as everything is a cycle. I do not intend to remain a consistent member of this group once the dust has settled. I anticipate that will be soon when the DAO is formed and active. The spirit and discourse of this community will change considerably once liquidity flows back to these collections. Sometimes my comments come across as over-critical, I understand that. But the reality is there are some extremely talented members in this group. The community is very resilient and committed. I have every confidence they will make this project a success.

content:
I could image the NFTs for example as an in game assets like Steam use skins for guns in CS:GO or whatever game. We have there almost zero fees thanks to reverse gas fee model and this is where it's interesting to see its integration. You are still owner of your assets + interoperability in other games.

Another use case if you are an musician and you want to track your fans, give them NFTs and it's super easy to give them benefits like discount to your concerts or some extra perks. You don't need to know them personally but thanks to these identifiers (NFTs) you know exactly that they support you and your creations. 

I think there are even more great use cases, but we need more adoption and easier interfaces for normies. They don't want to go through buggy apps or wallets, they just want to use e-mail or let's say Internet Identity and log everywhere and apps have to be intuitive.

I think most of the people are here for money at the first place, some are here to help ecosystem and build some great tools with funds motoko have in treasury. When we look at it as a whole NFT space it's hard to answer, but I would love to see high quality projects that are not just cash grabs and we can use them as catalyst to empover the whole ICP ecosystem. If the art is great just use it as a collectible it's fine, but this doesn't work much in these days. Look at ETH NFTs most of them are bad down. People are looking for the utilities not just for an art. üôÇ But that's my personal point of view.
That‚Äôs obviously across a much larger timeframe than we‚Äôre currently looking at, but I think the most potential for NFTs is outside of art
Canisters have the unique ability to hold both forward facing & private data - there‚Äôs alot of potential to explore on that front

I‚Äôm not to big on NFTs in their current form in complete transparency. I only hold Motoko & PokedBots. 

With that being said, I think ICP has the potential to offer unique usecases within NFTs. 

For example, imagine a world in which your birth certificate, passport, the deed to your house, etc, are ZK NFTs

I'm a bit sleep deprived, so forgive me if I'm not following the conversation well, but I think I may have also confused things.  I'll try to clear things up (big CYA... I do not represent DFINITY legal) ...

On IP - DFINITY owns the trademark to Motoko under many different trademark classes.  DFINITY has also followed the web3 example set by the Ethereum Foundation in very loosely managing/enforcing that trademark.  I can't say that will always be the case, but it is the case today (with obvious exceptions for illicit or untorrid usages).  MOTOKO DAO (or any other Motoko project) use the trademark somewhat at risk and should they worry about DFINITY changing its stance on its trademark, is free to discuss getting legal rights to the trademark.  This may be advantageous if the DAO becomes large enough and participants (with large financial pr other stakes) begin to worry about a risk of DFINITY "rugging" the trademark.  It's fully up to the DAO how they want to engage with DFINITY.  It should be said though (and I'm no lawyer, so this is just how I understand the situation based on a few convos with lawyers) that legal agreements in which one side receives something and the other side does not actually open up a lot of legal risk.  So (and again, I'm one of the decision makers on this within DFINITY) I would expect DFINITY to have some requests, like "in exchange for access to the motoko trademark, MOTOKO DAO will do xyz...".  Given the goals of DFINITY and MOTOKO DAO are aligned, I imagine any agreement would be in both party interests (as in, xyz above would be something the DAO would want to do anyways)

In complete transparency; 

We developed a 1:1 swap for the token migration. 

We asked Sonic to audit it. 

We were told it would be audited & they‚Äôd reach out if there were issues. 

Leading into the launch, we were informed it was in fact not audited. 

We asked them again to audit it, & we received a multiple week timeframe, as the SNS proposal was live. 

We were then put in a position in which we had to either:

1) Further delay the 1:1 Swap
2) Use the battle tested framework offered by ICP Swap

We obviously chose the option that allowed us to enact the 1:1 Swap without putting more time between launch & negotiation with DFINITY. 

So I understand you‚Äôre upset there‚Äôs a 1% slippage (that the DAO is collecting & can redistribute to you) when you migrate your pre-SNS to SNS tokens, but the alternative is sitting idle while development is completed, when we have things we need to accomplish to continue moving.

referenced_message.content:
From Bioniq you can only send reserved ordinals to other BTC addresses. This is to prevent people from sending to Stoic or Plug (which don't support Bioniq ordinals). 

If you want to send to an external Bitcoin address (Xverse, Leather, Unisat) you need to inscribe first then send to the external BTC address.

If you want to send to another Bioniq user, then just get their Bioniq BTC address from them and send. It will send fully on Bioniq (no Bitcoin transaction needed), we just use the BTC address to prevent people from sending to addresses that aren't compatible with Bioniq ordinals.

content:
Estimating Bitcoin fees is more of an art than a science. We base the sats/vb inscribing rates that we use off the suggested fee rates on mempool.space. If you notice, this block had some crazy fees being paid (7567 sats/vb at the top). This elevates the fee rate suggestion by mempool.space, which results in a higher than normal sats/vb for inscribing. This explains why your inscription transaction was sent through at 96 sats/vb.

There are more complicated ways to estimate fees, but you never end up with a perfect algorithm.

Exactly, each session creates a new public/private key pair at the top of it with a delegation (believe 8 hrs is the default) to the public/private key of your Trusted Platform module, USB key, or whatever you are using for authentication. 

That way you don't have to sign each message by touching your key or using your fingerprint scanner or whatever.

It's WebAuthn standard, Internet Identity is a superset of that actually.

referenced_message.content: Does short lived session key pairs mean that unique key pairs are continuously generated like with the newer car security systems or is this something else

content: Does short lived session key pairs mean that unique key pairs are continuously generated like with the newer car security systems or is this something else

referenced_message.content:
Yes, because you are dealing with short-lived session key pairs.

Internet Identity is setup in a way to use Hardware module / Roaming USB keys, each keep the private key safe and cannot be extracted under normal circumstances, even in the case of device compromised with malware as it's a hardware-based protection. As a user, even you cannot get access to the private key material in these devices. Message goes in, signed message comes out. It's the same concept credit cards with the chip use.

referenced_message.content:
Being that most browsers are now disabling unpartitioned Third Party storage and it is expected to be the behavior moving forward this could be opening up security vulnerabilities-- namely iFrames from different sites being able to access unpartitioned local stoarge that does not belong to them.

As an example as to what could go wrong here, stoicwallet stores the seed phrase in plain text in what should probably remain partitioned storage to be on safe side-- another reason I would strongly recommend migrating away from seed phrase based accounts used here (Internet Identity-based should be the safer option with stoic). The current workaround solution to disable all third party partitioning leaves a bit of a window cracked for a potential exploit of this, for one of the sites it was disabled for, or something completely unrelated that also stores private data in local storage that is intended to only be readable by that site.

Third Party storage disabling for individual sites by browser:
 - Chrome: haven't found a way to do disable third party storage partitioning for individual sites  here yet, downloading Chrome Canary for ICP stuff and having different settings there may be a good workaround for now, this is a suggested flow by google for Developers to test things. The icon is yellow and different and the version is always a bit on the bleeding edge, you get to see new features first, but may not be as stable.

- Brave: clicking the Brave sheild logo in the right of the address bar you can `Enable all trackers and ads` for an individual site, just tested this with Entrepot after returning that `third party partitioning` flag to `default` and stoicwallet works doing this.

The current workaround solution to disable all third party partitioning leaves a bit of a window cracked for a potential exploit of this, for one of the sites it was disabled for, or something completely unrelated that also stores private data in local storage that is intended to only be readable by that site.

Third Party storage disabling for individual sites by browser:
 - Chrome: haven't found a way to do disable third party storage partitioning for individual sites  here yet, downloading Chrome Canary for ICP stuff and having different settings there may be a good workaround for now, this is a suggested flow by google for Developers to test things. content:
Do i think Plug wallet is intending to do anything nefarious? **No.**

This is how these wallets were made to work, likely for convenience.

**... I just believe that with this kind of permissions by default there should be source code available.**

*My recommendation would be to limit these permissions to IC sites by right-clicking the extension.*

I haven't used metamask much at all to know how the flow works when it is used

My opinion is that: 
1) **Google doesn't lie here**
2) **It wouldn't be as big of an issue for me if the app was entirely open source**. When Psychedelic was building it, it was entirely open source, currently if you examine the code in the extension it is minified without sourcemaps unless something changed. Bitfinity has sourcemaps (this can be intentional or accidental for both apps as some frameworks create sourcemaps without opting-in)

Minification makes it hard to interpret what is going on because the variable names go from something like `principalId` to `a`, `b`, `c`, ...amongst other code-optimizations and compatibility tweaks that reduce readability.

*Sourcemaps enable code to be minimized for compatibility and performance but still be able to see the variable names and how the code was written in chrome dev tools.*

The app can be coded in ways to progressively ask for features to avoid this warning.

I believe this may be due to how Plug/Bitfinity adds `window.ic.plug` provider to every site so the site can iteract with it.

I checked before installing and this was the setting on the old app and for Bitfinity too, but now it's doing something, likely not intentionally that requires it up front which isn't really best practice.

For comparision this is the setting of Metamask.

Exactly! After inscribing a Sentinel, the Sentinel gets an inscription id and is accessible in bioniq with its inscription id (no more accessible with the token id)
Example:
Sentinel bioniq url before inscription: https://bioniq.io/inscription/3m2kl-kykor-uwiaa-aaaaa-c4cfc-4aqca-aaby2-a
Same Sentinel bioniq url after inscribing it: https://bioniq.io/inscription/fb75a2d13dbf1729e05bfbbffe8feb37380e077a7517b0acd2748d465124c8d9i0

To get the token id and use it in rarity tools:
1) Access this url and modify it with your inscription Id : https://api.bioniq.io/v1/inscription/fb75a2d13dbf1729e05bfbbffe8feb37380e077a7517b0acd2748d465124c8d9i0?protocol=ckBTC
2) get "asset_token_id" attribute from the response and use it in rarity tools

It would be better if the sentinels are accessible by both their tokenid and inscriptionid, changing id after inscribing has impacts for example on @dab1rd's bot that no longer detects listings of inscribed sentinels

Sonic obviously made efforts to help out, Side Effect & Bugslayer spent ALOT of time with Rem trying to sort through the swap last minute, but at the end of the day, they‚Äôre all really busy people, and I had to make the call to utilize ICP Swap in contrast to continuously pouring development resources into something with an unknown timeline, when we were working within a strict one already.

In complete transparency; 

We developed a 1:1 swap for the token migration. 

We asked Sonic to audit it. 

We were told it would be audited & they‚Äôd reach out if there were issues. 

Leading into the launch, we were informed it was in fact not audited. 

We asked them again to audit it, & we received a multiple week timeframe, as the SNS proposal was live. 

We were then put in a position in which we had to either:

1) Further delay the 1:1 Swap
2) Use the battle tested framework offered by ICP Swap

We obviously chose the option that allowed us to enact the 1:1 Swap without putting more time between launch & negotiation with DFINITY. 

So I understand you‚Äôre upset there‚Äôs a 1% slippage (that the DAO is collecting & can redistribute to you) when you migrate your pre-SNS to SNS tokens, but the alternative is sitting idle while development is completed, when we have things we need to accomplish to continue moving.
You say that as if you had nothing to do with the creation of DAO and didn't answer in such a way that your answer required an answer from your interlocutor as well :)
